intro: Erythrostemon robinsonianus, commonly known as the Robust St. John's Wort, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and woody stems, which are typical of the Physostegia genus. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Erythrostemon robinsonianus is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and other moist habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
